name: Dar-us-Sakina
mission: DAR-US-SAKINA IS A 501(C)(3) NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO INCLUSION OF INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE MUSLIM COMMUNITY OF HOUSTON. OUR PLATFORM IS A SAFE SPACE FOR PEOPLE OF ALL ABILITIES AND THEIR CAREGIVERS. WE INSPIRE THE COMMUNITY TO ABANDON STIGMAS AND EMBRACE INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WITH EMPATHY AND RESPECT. TOGETHER, WE ARE BETTER.
theoryOfChange: Dar-us-Sakina outlines its strategic framework through its Mission, Vision, and Values, and details its approach to impact measurement on its 'About Us' page and in its annual reports. The organization fulfills its mission through programming in three key service areas: education, support, and community awareness. Within this framework, they provide diverse opportunities for individuals with disabilities and their families. Their 'Our Impact' section on the website tracks specific metrics such as 478 special needs families registered, 358 caregivers enrolled in support groups, 108 special needs students in Islamic education, 9,660 hours of volunteer service, and 350 community members trained in disability awareness. An annual report further elaborates on their programs, goals (e.g., expanding their Teen Adult program), and the demographics they serve, including percentages for various disabilities.
zakatClaimEvidence: Zakat Program For special needs families in crisis, we are committed to providing comprehensive support through our Zakat Fund. (Source: https://storage.e.jimdo.com/file/46e685bd-42f9-4e42-bec8-dd794366b915/D_AnnualReport2024_R3.pdf)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fi_sabilillah (+5); Humanitarian service (+2)

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.

components.improvement_suggestion: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.

score_details.score_summary: Dar-us-Sakina shows strong impact and good alignment, with zakat compliance.

all_citations.claim: Dar-us-Sakina holds a Charity Navigator score of 93.0/100 and maintains a fundraising efficiency of $0.13 per $1 raised.
The organization reported total revenue of $540,354 and a program expense ratio of 72.2%.
The mission is to provide inclusive opportunities for individuals with disabilities in the Muslim community of Houston.
Programs include specialized education and internship opportunities for teens and adults.
The organization focuses on services and initiatives that benefit individuals with special needs.
The charity tracks metrics such as students receiving Islamic education and community members trained in disability awareness.
Families are supported through a Zakat Fund, and the organization tracks special needs student enrollment.
The organization provides options for Zakat-eligible donations.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Dar-us-Sakina earns a GMG score of 63/100, reflecting a high-performing financial structure and strong alignment with religious values, though impact scores are moderated by the high-touch, high-cost nature of specialized disability services.
areas_for_improvement: Enhance data transparency to improve the medium data confidence rating
Expand program reach to lower the relatively high cost per beneficiary of approximately $3,948

dimension_explanations.alignment: Dar-us-Sakina shows high donor fit for the Muslim community by addressing the urgent religious and cultural need for disability inclusion [3][6]. Its Zakat-eligible status and focus on community training in disability awareness further solidify its standing as a critical niche service provider [10][11].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high directness through capacity building, focusing on student enrollment in Islamic education and caregiver support [9][10]. While the program expense ratio is 72.2%, the cost per beneficiary is relatively high at $3,948.09, which is typical for intensive, specialized disability programming [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Dar-us-Sakina empowers individuals with disabilities in the Houston Muslim community through inclusive education and specialized support services.
strengths: High financial accountability with a Charity Navigator score of 93.0/100 [1]
Strong liquidity with 15.9 months of working capital available to sustain operations [1][2]
Efficient fundraising operations, spending only $0.13 to raise every $1 [1]
baseline_narrative.summary: Dar-us-Sakina provides essential services including Islamic education, vocational internships, and volunteer enrichment to foster an inclusive environment for individuals with special needs [3][4]. The organization is recognized as Zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations while supporting disability advocacy [10][11].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Dar-us-Sakina earns a GMG score of 63/100, reflecting a high-performing financial structure and strong alignment with religious values, though impact scores are moderated by the high-touch, high-cost nature of specialized disability services.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization has a relatively high cost per beneficiary of approximately <cite id="10">$3,948</cite>, which could be improved by expanding program reach.
The charity currently has a <cite id="1">MEDIUM data confidence rating</cite>, indicating room for improvement in public data sharing and transparency.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The high cost per beneficiary is typical for specialized disability services, which require intensive, individualized support.
case_against.summary: The primary concern for donors may be the relatively high cost per beneficiary and limited data transparency.

confidence.notes: Data confidence is medium due to lack of transparency in some areas.

known_gaps: Missing detailed employee and volunteer counts

alignment.explanation: Dar-us-Sakina is highly aligned with Muslim donor priorities, offering <cite id="11">Zakat-eligible</cite> programs that serve the fi_sabilillah asnaf and focus on religious and cultural causes.
alignment.improvement: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust Dar-us-Sakina due to its <cite id="1">93/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and perfect scores in <cite id="1">Culture (100) and Leadership (100)</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the charity could improve its data transparency to raise its current MEDIUM data confidence rating.

impact.explanation: The organization demonstrates impact through its capacity-building delivery model and strong financial health, including <cite id="1">15.9 months of working capital</cite>.
impact.improvement: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support inclusive education and specialized services for individuals with disabilities within the Houston Muslim community, and who value strong financial accountability.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations while supporting disability advocacy
Care deeply about inclusive education and community awareness
Value organizations with strong financial health and efficiency
giving_considerations: Programs are localized to the Houston area
Specialized services result in a higher cost per beneficiary
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking international humanitarian relief or those who prioritize low cost-per-beneficiary metrics over specialized, intensive support.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization has verified evidence and outcomes, and a strong theory of change, but lacks rigorous third-party evaluations like RCTs.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Dar-us-Sakina empowers individuals with disabilities through inclusive education, specialized support services, and community awareness programs.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that specialized programs are effectively meeting the needs of individuals with disabilities and improving their quality of life.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With strong revenue growth and localized focus, the organization has capacity to expand its specialized services to more individuals.

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="1">93/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting high standards of financial health and accountability.
Dar-us-Sakina is highly efficient in its fundraising efforts, spending only <cite id="1">$0.13 to raise every $1</cite>.
The charity holds <cite id="1">15.9 months of working capital</cite>, providing significant stability to sustain operations during economic fluctuations.

strengths_deep_dive: Dar-us-Sakina demonstrates exceptional financial stewardship, evidenced by its <cite id="1">93/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>. The organization operates with remarkable efficiency, spending just <cite id="1">$0.13 to raise every $1</cite>. Furthermore, its financial stability is underscored by <cite id="1">15.9 months of working capital</cite>, ensuring that critical programs for individuals with disabilities can continue uninterrupted even during challenging economic periods. The charity has also experienced significant growth, with a <cite id="2">3-Year Revenue CAGR of 24.6%</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: Dar-us-Sakina is a Houston-based organization dedicated to providing inclusive opportunities for individuals with disabilities within the Muslim community. The organization operates with <cite id="2">$540,354 in annual revenue</cite> and maintains a <cite id="1">93/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>. Their programs focus on education, support, and community awareness, including initiatives like the Sakina Sunday School and the Teen Adult Program (TAP). The charity is <cite id="11">Zakat-eligible</cite>, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations while supporting disability advocacy and services. Dar-us-Sakina demonstrates strong financial health with <cite id="1">15.9 months of working capital</cite> and highly efficient fundraising, spending just <cite id="1">$0.13 to raise every $1</cite>.
